title: 114_s2560
content: The Act titled "Making College Affordable and Accessible Act of 2016" introduces Credit-Based Academic Transition Programs under the Higher Education Act of 1965. This amendment includes changing the fiscal year to 2017 and adding a new section 745 for these programs. The purpose of this section is to expand access for high school students to credit-based academic transition programs through partnerships between high schools and eligible institutions of higher education. Grants may be awarded to eligible institutions to carry out these programs. An eligible institution seeking a grant must submit an application to the Secretary. Priority for grants is given to institutions serving low-income, rural, or first-generation college students. Grant funds must be used for dual enrollment or early college programs allowing high school students to earn college credits. The institution aims to help students earn college credits transferable to higher education institutions. It also provides professional development for teachers and supports curriculum design for dual enrollment programs. The institution offers postsecondary credit programs for 2-year and 4-year higher education institutions in the State, outreach programs for elementary and secondary school students, assistance in meeting eligibility criteria for postsecondary courses, and coordination of support services and academic calendars. An eligible institution receiving a grant can use funds for credit-based academic transition programs, covering tuition, fees, books, materials, and transportation. The institution must evaluate program effectiveness and submit a report to the Secretary. The institution receiving a grant must evaluate and report on the effectiveness of credit-based academic transition programs to the Secretary. No requirements inconsistent with State law shall be imposed on any State or public institution of higher education.
